hadiths.text: Narrated Dhul-Jawshan: A man of ad-Dabab, said: When the Prophet (ﷺ) became free from the people of Badr I brought to him a colt of my mare called al-Qarha' I said: Muhammad, I have brought a colt of a al-Qarha' , so that you may take it. He said: I have no need of it. If you wish that I give you a select coat of mail from (the spoils of) Badr, I shall do it. I said: I cannot give you today a colt in exchange. He said: Then I have no need of it

chapter.ara-name: باب فِي حَمْلِ السِّلاَحِ إِلَى أَرْضِ الْعَدُوِّ
chapter.eng-name: Regarding Carrying Weapons To The Land Of The Enemy
